author: fielding
msg: This may sound weird, but the JSPA 2.5 agreement that Apache insisted
upon for the Java Community Process has a bunch of conditions that
apply to licensing the Reference Implementation and TCK.  My company
(Day Software) would like to enable the ASF to manage the RI for
JSR 170 (Java Content Repository) as part of the Jakarta Slide project,
but we can't do that without terms in place prior to Community Review.
Here are the terms we are intending to use, though the ones in Day's
license do not mention Apache.  This document is for discussion by the
board and the jcp lists, in case Apache wishes to become a Spec Lead.

Hope this would help other committers alot, as a result.
